intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium pallescens subsp. hittense, commonly known as the Hittense hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and flowering stems that bear yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species in parts of its range.
